thread.title: Carlton Cole joins Indonesian club Persib Bandung to link up with Michael Essien at ambitious side
thread.title_full: Carlton Cole joins Indonesian club Persib Bandung to link up with Michael Essien at ambitious side

author: dwright
title: Carlton Cole joins Indonesian club Persib Bandung to link up with Michael Essien at ambitious side
text:
par score Carlton Cole joins Indonesian club Persib Bandung to link up with Michael Essien at ambitious side 
Former West Ham and England star Cole has agreed one-year deal with Persib who signed Essien last week By Duncan Wright 30th March 2017, 8:58 am Updated: 30th March 2017, 12:01 pm Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments FORMER West Ham and England striker Carlton Cole has followed Michael Essien in joining Indonesian side Persib Bandung. 
Cole, 34, has signed a one year contract with the club which is spending big in an attempt to become a major force on Asian football. Getty Images 4 Carlton Cole has joined Parsib Bandung in the Indonesian League 
Ex-Chelsea midfielder Essien agreed to join Persib earlier this month and said he hoped other Premier League players would follow him. 
Keep up to date with ALL the latest football news , gossip and rumours 
And Cole has done just that by agreeing to play in Indonesia after a year in America with Sacramento Republic. Twitter/Parsib 4 Carlton Cole will wear the number 12 at Parsib next season 
The striker was hailed as one of the brightest prospects in England when he came through the ranks at Chelsea and was handed his first team debut by Claudio Ranieri. 
But he struggled to establish himself at Stamford Bridge as Roman Abramovich splashed out big money on improving the squad – and eventually moved on to West Ham after a series of loan spells around the country. Knee injuries blighted his progress while he never fulfilled the early promise shown at Chelsea. 
But he did make enough of an impact to force his way into Fabio Capello’s England squad, making seven appearances for the country.
